text: Guardians of Hoeth
The sages of the White Tower select elven noble children who are eager for knowledge, teaching them swordsmanship and magic to become the defenders of the White Tower.
The sages of the White Tower select elven noble children who are eager for knowledge, teaching them swordsmanship and magic to become the defenders of the White Tower.
Eternal Guard (Spears)
Some elves choose to return to Avelorn to serve the Everqueen, forming the Eternal Guard who use polearms.
Some elves choose to return to Avelorn to serve the Everqueen, forming the Eternal Guard who use polearms.
Eternal Guard (Dual Swords)
Some elves choose to return to Avelorn to serve the Everqueen, forming the Eternal Guard who use dual swords.
The Everqueen’s maidens use dual swords in battle like valkyries.
Eternal Guard (Bows)
Some elves choose to return to Avelorn to serve the Everqueen, but only the finest Eternal Maidens can join the Eternal Guards.
Skilled in the use of bows and spears, the Eternal Maidens.
Riders of Avelorn
Some elves choose to return to Avelorn to serve the Everqueen, but only the finest Eternal Maidens can join the Eternal Guards.
The Everqueen’s mobile guard, effective at long-range but weak in melee.
Avelorn Sisters of the Thorn
Some elves choose to return to Avelorn to serve the Everqueen, but only the finest Eternal Maidens can join the Eternal Guards.
Thorn Sisters who left Athel Loren returned to Avelorn to serve the Everqueen.
Avelorn Hawk Riders
Some elves choose to return to Avelorn to serve the Everqueen, but only the finest Eternal Maidens can join the Eternal Guards.
The Everqueen’s airborne mobile guard, suited for striking from high altitudes and scouting the battlefield.
Great Stag Sisters
Some elves choose to return to Avelorn to serve the Everqueen, but only the finest Eternal Maidens can join the Eternal Guards.
Eternal Maidens use giant elk as mounts to become Avelorn’s elite cavalry.
Hunters of Chrace
Hunters of Chrace live in the deep mountains, making their archery and spear skills exceptional.
Hunters of Chrace live in the deep mountains, making their archery and spear skills exceptional.
Phoenix Swordmasters
Guardians of the Phoenix Temple, their weapons are blessed with both ice and fire due to the protection of both the Frost Phoenix and the Flame Phoenix.
Guardians of the Phoenix Temple, their weapons are blessed with both ice and fire due to the protection of both the Frost Phoenix and the Flame Phoenix.
White Lions of Chrace (Dual Axes)
The warriors of Chrace, due to their character and way of life, choose to wield sharp dual axes as their weapon.
The warriors of Chrace, due to their character and way of life, choose to wield sharp dual axes as their weapon.
Hoeth Mages
The Great Mages of Hoeth use their long lifespans to continuously study the mysteries of magic while also learning other skills, such as combat.
The Great Mages of Hoeth use their long lifespans to continuously study the mysteries of magic while also learning other skills, such as combat.
Caledor Dragon Knights
As former companions of the Phoenix King of Caledor, they possess combat skills rivaling those of the Phoenix Guard.
As former companions of the Phoenix King of Caledor, they possess combat skills rivaling those of the Phoenix Guard.
Yvressi Champions
They patrol the mists of Yvresse with ruthlessness and resolve, displaying the purest and bravest heroism when evil approaches.
They patrol the mists of Yvresse with ruthlessness and resolve, displaying the purest and bravest heroism when evil approaches.
Pride of the White Lions
An army composed of the elite of the White Lions regiment, each of whom has earned their companion during their trials.
An army composed of the elite of the White Lions regiment, each of whom has earned their companion during their trials.
Sons of Rahagra
Lions that defeat elves in the White Lion hunting grounds are recognized by Rahagra, the Father of Lions, and become the Sons of Rahagra.
Lions that defeat elves in the White Lion hunting grounds are recognized by Rahagra, the Father of Lions, and become the Sons of Rahagra.
Corsair Mariners
Elves living by the sea are occasionally summoned by the emissaries of Mathlann to become warriors riding flying fish.
Elves living by the sea are occasionally summoned by the emissaries of Mathlann to become warriors riding flying fish.
Cothique Shore Watchers
In the kingdom of Cothique, elves who worship Mathlann are selected as sea messengers, riding flying fish and using magical bows to attack any enemy approaching Ulthuan.
In the kingdom of Cothique, elves who worship Mathlann are selected as sea messengers, riding flying fish and using magical bows to attack any enemy approaching Ulthuan.
Cothique Deep-Sea Marauders
Among the emissaries of Mathlann, some elves who live in the deep sea use heavy weapons to attack any target they see.
Among the emissaries of Mathlann, some elves who live in the deep sea use heavy weapons to attack any target they see.
Cothique Abyss Observers
Warriors from Cothique selected by Mathlann, who constantly monitor various evil activities in the abyss.
Warriors from Cothique selected by Mathlann, who constantly monitor various evil activities in the abyss.
Sea Masters
Sea Masters are the most elite troops of Cothique, each of whom must undergo the trials of the deep sea to gain their formidable power.
Sea Masters are the most elite troops of Cothique, each of whom must undergo the trials of the deep sea to gain their formidable power.
Dragon Knights
Due to the rarity of dragons, dragon princes rarely get the chance to ride them, but a few rare Caledor knights have had the opportunity to ride dragons.
Due to the rarity of dragons, dragon princes rarely get the chance to ride them, but a few rare Caledor knights have had the opportunity to ride dragons.
Brave Archers
Veterans of numerous Elven battles, these warriors are deeply disappointed by the state of their people. However, they still hone their skills, using their weapons in various trials.
Brave Archers, dispatched by Tyrion to engage in the most difficult of battles, their extraordinary archery skills make them unstoppable on the battlefield.
Brave Blademen
Veterans of numerous Elven battles, these warriors are deeply disappointed by the state of their people. However, they still hone their skills, using their weapons in various trials.
They are the damage-dealers of the Brave Legion, skilled in striking down enemies, whether they wear heavy armor or light armor.
Brave Guardians
Veterans of numerous Elven battles, these warriors are deeply disappointed by the state of their people. However, they still hone their skills, using their weapons in various trials.
Brave Guardians are the protectors of the legion, usually standing in the most dangerous spots on the battlefield. No foe, whether using ranged or close combat, can breach their shield wall.
